Title: Test Minimum Password Length
Description: Verify that the system allows a user to create an account with the minimum password length.
Steps: 1. Navigate to the registration page. 2. Enter valid username, email, and other required fields. 3. Enter a password with the minimum length (e.g., 8 characters).
Action: Enter a password with the minimum length.
Result: The system should allow the user to create an account successfully.

Title: Test Maximum Password Length
Description: Verify that the system allows a user to create an account with the maximum password length.
Steps: 1. Navigate to the registration page. 2. Enter valid username, email, and other required fields. 3. Enter a password with the maximum length (e.g., 20 characters).
Action: Enter a password with the maximum length.
Result: The system should allow the user to create an account successfully.

Title: Test Just Below Minimum Password Length
Description: Verify that the system does not allow a user to create an account with a password length just below the minimum.
Steps: 1. Navigate to the registration page. 2. Enter valid username, email, and other required fields. 3. Enter a password with a length just below the minimum (e.g., 7 characters).
Action: Enter a password with a length just below the minimum.
Result: The system should display an error message indicating that the password is too short.

Title: Test Just Above Maximum Password Length
Description: Verify that the system does not allow a user to create an account with a password length just above the maximum.
Steps: 1. Navigate to the registration page. 2. Enter valid username, email, and other required fields. 3. Enter a password with a length just above the maximum (e.g., 21 characters).
Action: Enter a password with a length just above the maximum.
Result: The system should display an error message indicating that the password is too long.

Title: Test Invalid Password Format
Description: Verify that the system does not allow a user to create an account with an invalid password format.
Steps: 1. Navigate to the registration page. 2. Enter valid username, email, and other required fields. 3. Enter a password that does not meet the required format (e.g., no special characters).
Action: Enter a password that does not meet the required format.
Result: The system should display an error message indicating that the password format is invalid.

Title: Validate User Login with Correct Credentials
Description: Verify that the system allows a user to log in with valid credentials.
Steps: 1. Navigate to the login page. 2. Enter a valid username and password. 3. Click the login button.
Action: Enter valid credentials and log in.
Result: The user should be successfully logged in and redirected to the dashboard.

Title: Attempt Login with Invalid Credentials
Description: Verify that the system prevents login with invalid credentials.
Steps: 1. Navigate to the login page. 2. Enter an invalid username and/or password. 3. Click the login button.
Action: Enter invalid credentials and attempt to log in.
Result: The system should display an error message and prevent login.

Title: Test SQL Injection on Login Page
Description: Verify that the system is resistant to SQL injection attacks on the login page.
Steps: 1. Navigate to the login page. 2. Enter SQL injection code in the username and/or password fields (e.g., ' OR '1'='1). 3. Click the login button.
Action: Enter SQL injection code and attempt to log in.
Result: The system should display an error message and prevent login.

Title: Test Session Hijacking
Description: Verify that the system is resistant to session hijacking attacks.
Precondition: A valid user session is active.
Steps: 1. Log in with a valid user account. 2. Capture the session ID. 3. Log out and log in with a different user account. 4. Use the captured session ID to attempt to access the first user's session.
Action: Attempt to hijack a valid user session using a captured session ID.
Result: The system should invalidate the session ID and prevent unauthorized access.

Title: Test Unauthorized Access to Patient Records
Description: Verify that unauthorized users cannot access patient records.
Precondition: A user is logged in with a non-doctor role.
Steps: 1. Log in with a non-doctor user account. 2. Attempt to access patient records.
Action: Attempt to access patient records with unauthorized access.
Result: The system should display an error message and prevent access to patient records.

Title: Load Test for Patient Registration
Description: Simulate multiple patients registering on the application to assess the system's performance under normal conditions.
Steps: 1. Simulate 100 concurrent users accessing the registration page. 2. Each user fills out the registration form with unique data. 3. Submit the registration forms.
Action: Simulate 100 concurrent users registering on the application.
Data: Unique user data for each of the 100 users.
Result: All users should be able to register successfully within an acceptable response time (e.g., 5 seconds).

Title: Stress Test for Doctor Appointment Booking
Description: Push the system beyond its limits by simulating a high number of concurrent users booking appointments to identify breaking points.
Precondition: 1000 doctors and 1000 patients are pre-registered in the system.
Steps: 1. Simulate 5000 concurrent users attempting to book appointments with the available doctors. 2. Monitor the system's response time and error rates.
Action: Simulate 5000 concurrent users booking appointments.
Result: The system should handle the load gracefully, with minimal errors and a response time of no more than 10 seconds. Identify the breaking point if any.

Title: Endurance Test for Diagnostic Center Report Upload
Description: Evaluate the system's ability to sustain a prolonged load of report uploads by diagnostic centers over an extended period.
Precondition: 50 diagnostic centers are pre-registered in the system.
Steps: 1. Simulate 50 diagnostic centers uploading reports continuously for 24 hours. 2. Monitor the system's performance and resource utilization.
Action: Simulate continuous report uploads for 24 hours.
Data: Report data for each diagnostic center.
Result: The system should sustain the load without significant degradation in performance or resource exhaustion.

Title: Scalability Test for Patient Report Access
Description: Determine the system's ability to handle an increasing number of patients accessing their reports concurrently.
Precondition: 1000 patients with pre-uploaded reports in the system.
Steps: 1. Start with 100 concurrent users accessing their reports. 2. Gradually increase the number of concurrent users by 100 every 5 minutes until reaching 1000 users. 3. Monitor the system's response time and resource utilization.
Action: Gradually increase the number of concurrent users accessing reports.
Data: Pre-uploaded report data for each patient.
Result: The system should handle the increasing load with acceptable response times (e.g., no more than 5 seconds) and minimal resource exhaustion.

Title: Load Test for Doctor Login
Description: Simulate multiple doctors logging into the application to assess the system's performance under normal conditions.
Precondition: 500 doctors are pre-registered in the system.
Steps: 1. Simulate 500 concurrent doctors logging into the application. 2. Monitor the system's response time and error rates.
Action: Simulate 500 concurrent doctors logging into the application.
Result: All doctors should be able to log in successfully within an acceptable response time (e.g., 3 seconds).

Title: Successful Patient Registration
Description: Verify that a patient can successfully register on the application.
Steps: 1. Navigate to the registration page. 2. Fill in the sign-up form with valid details. 3. Submit the form.
Action: Submit the sign-up form.
Data: Valid patient details (name, email, password, etc.)
Result: The patient is successfully registered, and a confirmation message is displayed.

Title: Invalid Patient Registration
Description: Verify that the system handles invalid inputs during patient registration.
Steps: 1. Navigate to the registration page. 2. Fill in the sign-up form with invalid details (e.g., invalid email format). 3. Submit the form.
Action: Submit the sign-up form with invalid data.
Data: Invalid patient details (e.g., invalid email format)
Result: An error message is displayed, and the registration is not completed.

Title: Boundary Value for Password Length
Description: Verify that the system handles the boundary value for password length during patient registration.
Steps: 1. Navigate to the registration page. 2. Fill in the sign-up form with a password that is exactly at the minimum length boundary. 3. Submit the form.
Action: Submit the sign-up form with a password at the minimum length boundary.
Result: The patient is successfully registered, and a confirmation message is displayed.

Title: Successful Doctor Login
Description: Verify that a doctor can successfully log in to the application.
Steps: 1. Navigate to the login page. 2. Enter valid username and password. 3. Click the login button.
Action: Click the login button with valid credentials.
Result: The doctor is successfully logged in, and the dashboard is displayed.

Title: Doctor Login with Invalid Credentials
Description: Verify that the system handles invalid credentials during doctor login.
Steps: 1. Navigate to the login page. 2. Enter invalid username and/or password. 3. Click the login button.
Action: Click the login button with invalid credentials.
Result: An error message is displayed, and the login is not successful.

Title: Validate System Response Time Under Load
Description: Measure the response time of the application under varying user loads to ensure it meets performance requirements.
Precondition: The application is deployed and accessible.
Steps: 1. Use a load testing tool to simulate 100 concurrent users accessing the application. 2. Measure the average response time for key functionalities such as login, appointment booking, and report viewing. 3. Increase the number of concurrent users to 500 and repeat the measurement. 4. Increase the number of concurrent users to 1000 and repeat the measurement.
Action: Simulate user load and measure response time.
Result: The average response time should be within acceptable limits (e.g., less than 2 seconds) for all user loads.

Title: Test Access Control for Different User Roles
Description: Verify that users can only access functionalities permitted by their roles.
Precondition: User accounts for Patient, Doctor, and Diagnostic Center are created.
Steps: 1. Log in as a Patient and attempt to access Doctor and Diagnostic Center functionalities. 2. Log in as a Doctor and attempt to access Patient and Diagnostic Center functionalities. 3. Log in as a Diagnostic Center and attempt to access Patient and Doctor functionalities.
Action: Attempt to access restricted functionalities.
Result: The system should deny access to restricted functionalities and display an appropriate error message.

Title: Verify User Interface Clarity and Intuitiveness
Description: Assess the ease of use and intuitiveness of the application's user interface.
Precondition: The application is deployed and accessible.
Steps: 1. Navigate through the application's main functionalities (e.g., registration, login, appointment booking). 2. Observe the clarity of labels, buttons, and navigation menus. 3. Perform tasks such as searching for a doctor, booking an appointment, and viewing reports. 4. Record any difficulties or confusion encountered during the tasks.
Action: Navigate and perform tasks using the user interface.
Result: The user interface should be clear, intuitive, and easy to navigate with minimal confusion.

Title: Assess System Behavior Under Failure Conditions
Description: Evaluate the system's reliability by simulating failure conditions and observing its behavior.
Precondition: The application is deployed and accessible.
Steps: 1. Simulate a database failure by temporarily disconnecting the database server. 2. Attempt to perform key functionalities such as login, appointment booking, and report viewing. 3. Observe the system's behavior and error handling during the failure. 4. Restore the database connection and observe the system's recovery process.
Action: Simulate failure and observe system behavior.
Result: The system should handle failures gracefully, display appropriate error messages, and recover quickly upon restoration of services.

Title: Check System Performance as User Load Increases
Description: Evaluate the system's scalability by increasing the user load and monitoring performance metrics.
Precondition: The application is deployed and accessible.
Steps: 1. Use a load testing tool to simulate 100 concurrent users accessing the application. 2. Monitor system performance metrics such as CPU usage, memory usage, and response time. 3. Increase the number of concurrent users to 500 and repeat the monitoring. 4. Increase the number of concurrent users to 1000 and repeat the monitoring.
Action: Simulate user load and monitor performance metrics.
Result: The system should maintain acceptable performance metrics and response times as the user load increases.

Title: Verify Password Policy Compliance
Description: Ensure that the system enforces strong password policies as per industry standards.
Steps: 1. Navigate to the registration page. 2. Attempt to create a new account with a weak password (e.g., "password"). 3. Attempt to create a new account with a strong password (e.g., "P@ssw0rd123").
Action: Create new accounts with different password strengths.
Result: The system should reject the weak password and accept the strong password.

Title: Verify Data Classification and Protection
Description: Ensure that patient data is classified and protected according to relevant regulations (e.g., HIPAA).
Precondition: A patient account exists with sensitive data.
Steps: 1. Log in as a patient. 2. Navigate to the profile section. 3. Attempt to view sensitive data (e.g., medical history).
Action: Access sensitive data as a patient.
Data: Patient login credentials, sensitive data fields.
Result: The system should display the sensitive data only to authorized users.

Title: Verify Inactivity Timeout
Description: Ensure that the system logs out users after a period of inactivity to prevent unauthorized access.
Precondition: A user is logged into the system.
Steps: 1. Log in as a user. 2. Leave the system idle for the specified inactivity timeout period. 3. Attempt to perform an action that requires authentication.
Action: Leave the system idle and attempt an authenticated action.
Data: User login credentials, inactivity timeout period.
Result: The system should log out the user and prompt for re-authentication.

Title: Verify Access Control for Diagnostic Center
Description: Ensure that only authorized Diagnostic Center users can access and modify patient records.
Steps: 1. Log in as a Diagnostic Center user. 2. Navigate to the patient records section. 3. Attempt to view and edit a patient's test results.
Action: Access and modify patient records as a Diagnostic Center user.
Data: Diagnostic Center login credentials, patient records.
Result: The system should allow the Diagnostic Center user to view and edit the patient's test results.

Title: Verify Data Integrity for Test Reports
Description: Ensure that test reports are accurate and authentic to prevent false medication.
Precondition: A patient has test reports available.
Steps: 1. Log in as a patient. 2. Navigate to the test reports section. 3. Verify the accuracy and authenticity of the test reports.
Action: View and verify test reports as a patient.
Result: The system should display accurate and authentic test reports.
